channel.title: Fear Factory - Request a Lock Please
channel.description:
[quote="Mendorphins"]Hey all. Some of you may have noticed my absence... I had a computer problem; good news is I'm back. Bad news is I didn't have a back-up my development, so it's lost forever.[/quote]
[center]Last Update: 4th March 2011 @ 1am [URL=http://img832.imageshack.us/i/titleboxe.png/][IMG]http://img832.imageshack.us/img83/1861/titleboxe.png[/img][/URL] [URL=http://img840.imageshack.us/i/67801888.gif/][IMG]http://img840.imageshack.us/img840/9479/67801888.gif[/img][/URL][/center]
Right then, this will probably be my downfall but I'm using the very client and server I downloaded that gave me a virus and cleaned my RuneScape account to make a RuneScape private server development.
It's also PI.
Now that I've got that out of the way, it's down to business. I've been wanting to create my own development thread for ages. I've had a few aspirations to create a 1 Player Server, a server from scratch and a server from nothing more than a framework, but I've realised these are far beyond me at the moment.
This may be something good or this may be something bad, depending on your personal opinion I suppose - I'll go by my own opinion and say it's something good.
[b][size=12pt][u]Progress Log[/b]
[ul]-Downloaded the source "Ambitionz Forever PI". -Deleted all malicious code. -New starting area/mini tutorial, Gnome Hangar. -New home, Tree Gnome Stronghold. -Edited the "Home Teleport" text. -Added the Woodcutting guild. -Added a new drop system via the Config class. -Added Tree spirits that drop Dragon axes as a rare drop in the Woodcutting guild. -Added a load of trees in the Woodcutting guild. -Tree Gnome Stronghold upstairs bank is now open. -Added a forum for the server (see my profile for the URL). -Customised the client. -Added Bronze and Iron axes. -Added axe speeds (Bronze slowest/Dragon fastest). -Fixed a Woodcutting bug where you would still recieve XP whilst your inventory was full. -Completely added the "tutorial". -Fixed the tutorial bugs where you would still have the "Getting Started" sendStatement upon completing it, and setting the side bar interface to 10 every time you clicked. -Fixed the totalLevel bug where it displayed 9,999 extra levels for every 1 level you gained. -Fixed the bug that respawned you in the same spot you died. -Disabled the walking in Firemaking until I've added a specific Firemaking Lane area (clipping every single non-walkable tile is a ridiculous task).[/ul]
[b][size=12pt][u]Current To Do List[/b]
[ul]-Fix the bug where you begin Woodcutting, walk away and still receive XP but no logs. -Fix a client interface bug (clicking on a sprite freezes the client).section[/ul]
[b][size=12pt][u]Long Term Goals[/b]
[ul]-Delete a lot of unnecessary code. -Fix the bug where you begin Woodcutting, walk away and still receive XP but no logs. -Fix a client interface bug (clicking on a sprite freezes the client). -Add a Firemaking Lane.[/ul]
[b][size=12pt][u]Features[/b] [b][u]Woodcutting[/b]
[ul]-Bronze axe, slow, through to Dragon axe, fast. -Tree felling, stump and re-growth. -Woodcutting guild with every tree (including Teak, Mahogany and Hollow) except Willow (no water). -Normal tree has 1 log whereas every other tree has randomly up to 26 logs. -Fairly common Birds' nest for a hefty supply of seeds, eggs and rings. -If you are wielding a Bronze axe and have a Rune axe in your inventory, it will cut with the Rune axe PROVIDING you have the required level (not even RuneScape has this; it will always cut with your wielded axe).[/ul]
[b][u]Firemaking[/b]
[ul]-Firemaking Lanes (specified areas to train Firemaking with 1 step west for every log lit). -If you light a log anywhere else you will not take a step west (to save no clipping). -Every log obtainable is supported. -Object creating and disappearing, creating ashes. -99 Firemaking skillcape has the real emote and animation. -Steady XP cocurrent to the servers general XP rate.
[URL=http://img846.imageshack.us/i/firemaking.gif/][IMG]http://img846.imageshack.us/img846/4995/firemaking.gif[/img][/URL][/ul]
[b][u]Other[/b]
[ul]-Every Skillcape is real 100% animated emotes. -Clipped tiles (specified only).[/ul]
[i]Adding more soon...[/i]
[b][size=12pt][u]More Information[/b]
The idea behind the name "Fear Factory", is that I first have to find a large building (or teleport between a few), so essentially a Factory, ran by an evil scientist who experiments and keeps a hoard of creatures all around the building (factory), so a Fear Factory. It will be the main source of monsters to kill, and you need a certain kill count for each floor and I may even incorporate the overall kill count for something else, like a ranking system in game, but I haven't quite figured that part out yet... the drops will be good too.
Although the person I downloaded the source from does not deserve any credit, I still know it's not yet a source by me.
I can assure you there is no more malicious code amongst the Java files (I checked them all, line by line). It has been deleted and I now plan to turn this whole pile of shit around in to great game-play.
A lot of you may not agree with this but game-play is at the top of my priorities, before performance. Mainly because I have more ideas and knowledge about content than the inner-workings and framework. I will get there though, step-by-step.
I want my server to have a lot of information, whether ingame or on some forums. I won't be using commands for playerRights < 3. Only I will have access to commands. The worst thing you can experience when logging on to a new server is lack of information. Every server is different, so how are you supposed to know where most things are? So I will be making sure that everything is explained clearly and easily available for the task in question.
I have an OCD that every NPC dialogue must be perfect, line for line, no gaps or straying words, that every sendMessage must use proper spelling and grammar. I strive for a professional, concise and simplistic look. If an area is interactive or in use, then everything around it should be interactive and in use. What's the point in having a lever that does nothing?
So this is a source that I'll be tidying up, adding to, editing bits, removing parts and pretty much perfecting to my standard.
I know everything you have to say about what I just wrote, stuff like:
"You will never have a perfect server." "If you can't code, don't bother." "Performance is key, noob."
and that's fine, you can say these sort of things - they do not phase me. I'll be doing what I'm doing and step-by-step making a game that is [i]my[/i] interprutation of fun.
[b][size=12pt][u]Media[/b]
Starting area (scroll the post right to see the full image): [URL=http://img291.imageshack.us/i/collagei.png/][IMG]http://img291.imageshack.us/img291/4981/collagei.png[/img][/URL] You begin in the Hangar, have a quick chat with the Finacial Advisor, who has been hired by King Bolren to welcome new comers.
Then, you can search the hangar for a few secret stashes of coins and then leave via the exit portal.
Afterwards, you could start Agility (which is perfect by the way) or anything else you fancy.
Other pictures: [IMG]http://img577.imageshack.us/img577/7599/pic7g.png[/img]
And if you get it right, a 4 hit range/dds combo: [IMG]http://img641.imageshack.us/img641/2789/faded.png[/img]

item.title: Fear Factory - Request a Lock Please
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA

@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Locked as requested. PM for an unlock if you want one.

Read full topic
item.source: Fear Factory - Request a Lock Please

item.title: Fear Factory - Request a Lock Please
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Well people… I learnt a bit MySQL:

@Wintercanon - I got onto Stonefall in the end. (Still too basic for me, but beautilful work, nevertheless).

…so yeah, MySQL. I’ve decided to use the release by killamess, called No-Doze.

Might leave out the Fear Factory theme for the time being, I’m bored of it - I’m just going to be one of among many, trying to create a clean, classic feel to a server.

I do have ideas for some really original stuff, so keep your eyes out for a new Project thread within the next couple of weeks.

Read full topic

I’ve made a Firemaking Lane that lets you walk west when you are in it and makes you stand still when you are not. See the image below for an example, the surrounding staglamites show the Firemaking Lane:

Smart; very smart…

item.title: Fear Factory - Request a Lock Please
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Cheers.

Months yet. After I’ve added the game play I’m going to strip it of everything else and then optimise the framework. I plan to host it though when the Fear Factory is put in properly, then run updates every week.

So, maybe until the end of March, but I’ll want some people to play it in a couple of weeks.

EDIT: Updated with a couple bug fixes.

EDIT 2: Updated a bit more.

Read full topic
item.source: Fear Factory - Request a Lock Please

item.title: Fear Factory - Request a Lock Please
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:47, topic:383639”]I already plan for it to be an ongoing quest. Not something you can just complete in an hour or even a day, something that just keeps you busy throughout the course of playing. The server itself is almost like one big quest, but not mandatory. People can choose to just play normally if they want.

I want lots to do, lots going on (non-crowded though) and no restrictions (and best of all; free).

Update, finished the logging in and getting started.

[URL=http://img291.imageshack.us/i/collagei.png/][IMG]http://img291.imageshack.us/img291/4981/collagei.png[/img ][/URL ]
You begin in the Hangar, have a quick chat with the Finacial Advisor, who has been hired by King Bolren to welcome new comers.

Then, you can search the hangar for a few secret stashes of coins and then leave via the exit portal.

Afterwards, you could start Agility (which is perfect by the way) or anything else you fancy.

Just fishing out a few bugs (every click puts you on the log out side bar and the “Getting Started” sendStatement doesn’t clear, even on re-log).[/quote]
Wow, sexy updates;
When do you think this will be completed in full?

Read full topic
item.source: Fear Factory - Request a Lock Please

item.title: Fear Factory - Request a Lock Please
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

I already plan for it to be an ongoing quest. Not something you can just complete in an hour or even a day, something that just keeps you busy throughout the course of playing. The server itself is almost like one big quest, but not mandatory. People can choose to just play normally if they want.

I want lots to do, lots going on (non-crowded though) and no restrictions (and best of all; free).

Update, finished the logging in and getting started.


You begin in the Hangar, have a quick chat with the Finacial Advisor, who has been hired by King Bolren to welcome new comers.

Then, you can search the hangar for a few secret stashes of coins and then leave via the exit portal.

Afterwards, you could start Agility (which is perfect by the way) or anything else you fancy.

Just fishing out a few bugs (every click puts you on the log out side bar and the “Getting Started” sendStatement doesn’t clear, even on re-log).

Read full topic
